name: Taipei 101
description: Towering, 106-floor modern skyscraper with light effects, shopping, dining & an observation deck.

name: Yangmingshan
tagline: Picturesque area with hiking & a volcano
description: Scenic destination with hot springs & hiking trails, plus the country's largest dormant volcano.

name: National Palace Museum
description: Bustling museum featuring one of the largest collections of Chinese art & artifacts in the world.

name: Ximending
description: Ximending is a neighborhood and shopping district in the Wanhua District of Taipei, Taiwan. It was the first pedestrian zone in Taiwan.

name: Chiang Kai-shek Memorial Hall
tagline: Famed memorial park with ponds & gardens
description: Celebrated memorial hall with history exhibits surrounded by a large park with fish ponds & gardens.

name: Lungshan Temple of Manka
description: This well-known temple originally built in the 1700s honors both Buddhist & Taoist deities.

name: Shilin Night Market
tagline: Vibrant indoor market with late hours
description: Sprawling shopping venue featuring hundreds of food & goods vendors selling well into the night.

name: Shifen Waterfall
tagline: Wide waterfall in a scenic setting
description: At 40 m. wide, this well-known cascade waterfall in scenic surrounds is the broadest in Taiwan.

name: Taipei Zoo
tagline: Sizable zoo with a gondola & kids' area
description: Large indoor-outdoor zoo in a scenic setting with a children’s area, gondola & shuttle train.

name: Maokong
description: Maokong is located in Wenshan District of Taipei, Taiwan. The area used to be the biggest tea growing area of Taipei. There are many intertwining footpaths which have been used to transport tea

name: Sun Yat-sen Memorial Hall
description: Multi-use structure built in 1972 to honor Sun Yat-sen, providing cultural & educational programs.

name: Tamsui Fisherman's Wharf
description: Picturesque wharf offering sunset views & a boardwalk with leisure, dining & sightseeing options.

name: Raohe Street Night Market
description: Buzzing, venerable nighttime street market offering street food, shops & carnival games.

name: Huashan 1914 Creative Park
description: Cultural hub in an old sake winery featuring shops & showcasing local art, film, crafts & events.

name: Songshan Cultural and Creative Park
tagline: Art & design in an old tobacco factory
description: Former tobacco factory warehouses turned exhibition spaces & shops for local artists & designers.

name: Fort San Domingo
tagline: Historic Spanish fort with water views
description: This hilltop Spanish fort constructed in 1629 features a lookout for scenic river views.

name: Shifen Old Street
description: Railroad tracks run through this old street with shops & restaurants, plus sky-lantern lightings.

name: 228 Peace Memorial Park
tagline: Urban park dedicated to the 228 Massacre
description: Tranquil park with paths & pavilions, plus monuments & a museum dedicated to the 228 Massacre.

name: Snake Alley
description: Hub of retail & food stalls known for an array of unique local eats, including snake delicacies.

name: Beitou Hot Spring Museum
description: Tudor-style museum & former bathhouse featuring facility tours & exhibits on regional hot springs.

name: Qixing Mountain
tagline: Mountain, volcano, park, hiking, and lake
description: Qixing Mountain, also spelled Qixingshan or Chihsing Mountain, is a mountain in Beitou District, Taipei, Taiwan. It is located on the Datun Volcano Group and is the highest mountain in the city

name: Grand Hotel Taipei
tagline: Posh lodging with dining, pools & golf
description: Palatial hotel featuring refined quarters, plus a driving range, 6 tennis courts & 2 restaurants.

name: Taipei 101 Observatory
description: Sleek 89th-floor observation deck offering sweeping, 360º city views & a souvenir shop.

name: National Taiwan Museum
tagline: Stately museum with a range of exhibits
description: Venerable national museum with a variety of exhibits, including history & natural history.

name: Daan Forest Park
tagline: Sprawling park in the heart of the city
description: Large city-center park offering grassy picnic areas, a playground, footpaths & ponds with wildlife.

name: Lin Family Mansion and Garden
description: Tranquil 4.9-acre property featuring an elegant mansion & classic Chinese garden architecture.

name: National Revolutionary Martyrs' Shrine
tagline: Shrine with a changing of the guard
description: Castlelike shrine dedicated to fallen soldiers & featuring a changing-of-the-guard ceremony.

name: Twatutia
description:
Twatutia, is an area in Datong District, Taipei, Taiwan. It was also known as Daitōtei during Japanese occupation, and Tataocheng or Dadaocheng during the Kuomintang era.
Twatutia was an important

name: Tamsui Old Street
tagline: Scenic riverside street with food stalls
description: Historic walkway with river views, plus souvenir shops, food stalls, restaurants & cafes.

name: Red House Theater
description: Built in 1908, this landmark 8-sided structure features exhibits, a teahouse, markets & theaters.

name: Hsing Tian Kong
description: Modern temple devoted to the patron saint of businessmen, with big red doors & dragon sculptures.

name: Shilin Official Residence
description: Prominent former home of late Republic of China President Chiang Kai-shek, featuring scenic gardens.

name: Bitan
description: Popular lake offering scenic cliffs, pedal boats, eateries & a suspension bridge for pedestrians.

name: Presidential Office Building
description: Baroque-style building & home to the President's office, completed in 1919 during Japanese rule.

name: Gongguan, Taipei
description: Bustling nighttime market with a wide range of vendors, including clothing retailers, cafes & more.

name: Taipei Fine Arts Museum
description: Museum showcasing contemporary Chinese & international art within a striking geometric building.

name: Tianmu, Shilin District
description: Tianmu is a neighborhood located in Shilin, Taipei City, Taiwan. Located on the northern border of Shilin District, Tianmu borders the neighboring district of Beitou and Yangmingshan National

name: Dahu Park
description: Sprawling lakefront park with a heated swimming pool, walking trails, monuments & public art.

name: New Taipei City Yingge Ceramics Museum
tagline: History of ceramics, classes & gift shop
description: Exhibits on the history of ceramics, particularly locally, plus a studio with classes & a gift shop.

name: National Museum of History
description: The National Museum of History is located in the Nanhai Academy in Zhongzheng District, Taipei, Taiwan and exhibits Taiwanese historical items. After the Republic of China government moved to

name: Mount Guanyin
description: This 616-m high extinct volcano offers a visitor center, hiking trails & an observation platform.

name: Wulai Hot Spring
description: The Wulai Hot Spring is a hot spring in Wulai District, New Taipei, Taiwan.

name: Xiangshan Hiking Trail
tagline: Steep paths & stairways to a viewpoint
description: Series of sheer paths & steps up to a viewing platform affording sweeping views of Taipei's skyline.

name: Museum of Contemporary Art Taipei
tagline: Historic school site housing modern art
description: Taiwan's first contemporary art museum is housed in a brick former school built in the early 1900s.

name: Dalongdong Baoan Temple
description: Landmark temple completed in 1831 featuring an 1804 dragon column in the main hall.

name: Jinbaoli Old Street
description: Qing dynasty market street serving up local delicacies including pastries, duck & taro cake.

name: Taipei Confucius Temple
description: Revered temple at 2,000-year-old site of the original home of Confucius, with tours & services.
